section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"School" means a private career school located outside the State.
"School" does not include a private career school that operates in the State pursuant to a certificate of approval issued under § 11-202(b) of this title.
"Solicitor" means a person engaged in the business, for compensation, of soliciting or offering to solicit students in this State to enroll in or apply for a program offered by a school.

text.section: A person may not act as a solicitor unless such person has a permit issued under this section.

section.section: A person wishing to act as a solicitor shall apply to the Commission for a permit.

The application shall be made on the forms the Commission provides, shall contain the information the Commission requires, and shall be accompanied by:
A copy of each type of contract offered by the solicitor to prospective students; and
Any advertising materials and other representations that are made by the school to its students or prospective students.

text.section: Each permit issued under this section expires on June 30 after its issuance and may be renewed annually on application and payment of the required fee.

section.section: The Commission shall consider the application and accompanying material.
If the Commission approves the application, it shall issue a permit to the solicitor, on payment of an initial fee of $25. The renewal fee is $25.

text.section:
After notice to the solicitor and an opportunity for a hearing, the Commission may revoke the solicitor's permit for:
Violation of a contract with a student; or
Any other good cause.
